title: Shoulder and Neck Pain Treatment
author: WebMD Editorial Contributors

sections.heading: 1. When to Seek Immediate Medical Care
content: See a doctor or go to a hospital emergency room if:
bullets: Pain is from a severe blow or injury
Neck pain radiates down the arms and legs
Headaches , numbness, tingling, or weakness occur with pain
The person has a stiff neck with fever , vomiting , and sensitivity to light

content_blocks.text: See a doctor or go to a hospital emergency room if:
associated_bullets: Pain is from a severe blow or injury
Neck pain radiates down the arms and legs
Headaches , numbness, tingling, or weakness occur with pain
The person has a stiff neck with fever , vomiting , and sensitivity to light

sections.heading: 2. Ease Muscle Spasms
bullets: Apply dry or moist heat.

sections.heading: 3. Reduce Swelling
bullets: If the area is inflamed, apply ice for 20 minutes 4 to 8 times a day.

items: If the area is inflamed, apply ice for 20 minutes 4 to 8 times a day.

sections.heading: 4. Relieve Pain
bullets: Give pain medication such as acetaminophen ( Tylenol ), ibuprofen ( Advil , Motrin ), or Naproxen ( Aleve , Naprosyn ).

items: Give pain medication such as acetaminophen ( Tylenol ), ibuprofen ( Advil , Motrin ), or Naproxen ( Aleve , Naprosyn ).

sections.heading: 5. Rest
bullets: The affected area should not be used for a day or two.
Normal activities should be gradually resumed.

items: The affected area should not be used for a day or two.
Normal activities should be gradually resumed.

sections.heading: 6. Follow Up
bullets: The person should see a doctor if pain doesn't get better or worsens.
The person may need an X-ray or CT scan depending on the symptoms or an MRI to determine whether the person has a herniated disc or other nerve compression.
